subject: RE: [junit] RE: Isolation or Collaboration
msgSnippet: ... The point is this:  the program is correct if the statements are A B C but incorrect with any other order. If I want to test A, I can invoke it directly.
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> That's a different issue, though. That the program has
> different effects if method calls are reordered is one thing;
> that the program fails *internally* if they're reordered is another.

The point is this: the program is correct if the statements are A B C but
incorrect with any other order.

If I want to test A, I can invoke it directly.

If I want to test B, I need to have A invoked first or I will be testing
something different than what is running in production (and potentially
incorrect anyway).

--
